attributes.action: DVLA should allow Keyworkers to take there driving tests.
attributes.additional_details: DVLA is not allowing key workers to take their theory test or practical tests during the second lockdown. Key workers are exempt from taking their theory test and practical test during the second lockdown. How are they meant to continue offering services to the core infrastructure. Why have they changed the rules from the first lockdown? - Keyworkers was allowed to book there test. Why has it changed now. Moreover, these services must be available for keyworkers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

Since you started your petition, the national lockdown in England has ended. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might also like to sign the following petitions:

Direct DVSA to fully reopen all driving test centres and release more test slots
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549644

Exempt driving tests and lessons from COVID-19 restrictions
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557462
